history.content:
I can't speak for acceptance rates after getting questions wrong, but I will say most interview questions are a decent amount different than in-class questions, but still on the same material. Most interview questions are similar to ones found on leetcode.com or hackerrank.com, and its generally considered pretty important to practice on those kind of sites. Also, most content (from my experience) has been from 61B or 170 (never the half of 170 after Dynamic Programming though).

I assume people from other schools/self-taught practice a lot on leetcode-type websites to do well in interviews. Other people should chime in though.

---

Just do a lot of Leetcode Medium.

I can't speak for acceptance rates after getting questions wrong, but I will say most interview questions are a decent amount different than in-class questions, but still on the same material. Most interview questions are similar to ones found on leetcode.com or hackerrank.com, and its generally considered pretty important to practice on those kind of sites. Also, most content (from my experience) has been from 61B or 170 (never the half of 170 after Dynamic Programming though).

I assume people from other schools/self-taught practice a lot on leetcode-type websites to do well in interviews. Other people should chime in though.

---

Hi! I would like to ask about how difficult are the interview problems. At berkeley, we have all seen many mentally-challenging and difficult questions during EECS exams or homework, there are many questions that are selective, and usually only 20~30% of students get a solid A.

However, it seems that for industry, people with a wide range of different background, including schools of varies ranking, different GPAs, can find a decent job in big companies if they work hard enough.

As a rising sophomore, I am wondering if the internship questions are as hard as the problems we face during our academic career at berkeley, and how is the “fault tolerance rate” for those interview problems? (Such as, if we are stuck on some questions, will the HR turn you down without doubt? Because there are many difficult questions at berkeley where people can stuck for hours.) If they are very difficult, how does people still pass them?

Thanks!
history.subject: How hard are the job interview questions?
